entry.title: Call snd_seq_ev_clear on Alsa MIDI send events
entry.content:
MIDI output is broken on Linux. The ALSA documentation shows that we

should be clearing events after declaring them. Clearing the event

allows MIDI output to send again.



It was probably working before just by coincidence, and the problem

was exposed by changes in the event structure.



Bug: 40940293

Change-Id: Ifc671cfb173351eff72f7f43c776ee84b7f8aef1

Commit-Queue: Michael Wilson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1261506}

entry.title: content::WebContents: revise a wrong comment on the coordinate system
entry.content:
The existing comment says the obtained view bounds are in the parent

window's coordinate system, but actual implementation calculates

the one in the global screen position.

So, this patch revises the comment so that it explains the current

API behavior correctly.

entry.title: Implement simple burn-in.
entry.content:
Remove search field debouncing and replace it with a burn in mechanism.

Results are published together after 400ms and then further results

are dropped.



Using 400ms as a safe value, with a target of 200ms once we optimize

the search enough.



Bug: b/324465975

entry.title: wayland: tabdrag: fix cancellation handling
entry.content:
So far, a mouse button release is being sent upon

wl_data_source.cancelled, which wrongly makes chrome's TabDragController

to think the session was successfully terminated. This fixes it by

synthesizing an ESC key pressed event instead.



Note: As a potential followup work, we should rethink how these events

are communicated from platform to client code in the UI stack. Ideally,

higher level UI code, such as chrome's TabDragController, shouldn't make

assumptions about how underlying APIs are designed, in this case, if key

events are available during drag sessions, or whether global screen

position of windows can be set programatically, etc.



R=aycyang



Bug: 323898566, 40940225, 41497106

Test: Manual tests on Lacros + tab drag interactive_ui_tests

entry.title: preload: Verify the session storage used when prerendering-into-new-tab
entry.content:
Session storage is a per tab/window level storage.

This CL makes sure that prerender whose target_hint is "_blank" uses

the same session storage across prerender activation, and it is

different from the initiator's as the prerender is in a different

tab. However, the session storage when prerendering will be reset

upon activation as in `RestartStorageServiceWhilePrerendering`. https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/preloading/prerender/prerender_browsertest.cc;l=8147?q=RestartStorageServiceWhilePrerendering&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



Bug: 41491484

[120/120] OBJC obj/ios/third_party/earl_grey2/app_framework_shared_library/WKWebView+GREYApp.o

...

fatal error: 'GREYWKWebViewNavigationDelegate.h' file not found

20 | #import "GREYWKWebViewNavigationDelegate.h"

entry.title: [Office upload] Expect empty dialog response when Files app was closed
entry.content:
When the Files app that the dialog is modal to closes, this also closes

the dialog with an empty user response. Previously it wasn't expected to

ever have an empty user response and no TaskResult was logged.



Now observe when the Files app closes through OnBrowserClosing().

When an empty user response is received and the Files app

was closed, then this response is equivalent to the user choosing

to Cancel. Log this TaskResult.



But if there is no record of the Files app closing, this is still

unexpected and no TaskResult should be logged.



Bug: b/324802520

entry.title: [office] serialise uploads
entry.content:
Every upload handler creates a separate CopyOrMoveIOTask for each file,

which does its own conflict resolution. This may result in tasks

resolving to the same destination file, and multiple source files being

copied to the same destination, losing one of the files.



In the long run we should have a single CopyOrMoveIOTask here, but

serialising uploads is the least invasive change at this point.



Bug: b/325356207

Change-Id: Ie5af1f0da346ef913fe8fa004418fb34c84a9139

entry.title: [Office upload] Use separate callbacks for the setup/move dialogs
entry.content:
The expected user responses of the setup flow and move confirmation dialogs are completely different. Previously only one callback,

OnDialogComplete, was used to handle both sets of responses. It makes

much more sense to have one callback for the setup flow dialogs and one

for the move confirmation dialogs.



Introduce OnSetupDialogComplete() and OnMoveConfirmationComplete() to

handle each of these responses.



The motivation for this change is that there is a different "Cancel"

user response for the setup dialog versus the move confirmation. If an

empty user response is received and it should be mapped to a "Cancel" user response, it is obvious which one it's supposed to be.



Bug: b/324802520

entry.title: Make MetricsServicesManagerClient the owner of SyntheticTrialRegistry.
entry.content:
With this change VariationsService will have a pointer to the SyntheticTrialRegistry, through which trials that branch within VariationsService can be registered (e.g. the limited entropy synthetic trial).



Currently, SyntheticTrialRegistry is owned by MetricsServiceClient, and is accessible from MetricsService. Since VariationsService is instantiated separately from MetricsService, to reach for SyntheticTrialRegistry, VariationsService will have to reach for g_browser_process->metrics_service(). However this requires g_browser_process to be initialized, which is not guaranteed when instantiating VariationsService.



To resolve this issue, the ownership of SyntheticTrialRegistry is lifted out of MetricsServiceClient, and is given to its owner, MetricsServicesManagerClient, which is also the owner of VariationsService. This way, both MetricsService and VariationsService will share the same instance of SyntheticTrialRegistry at instantiation.



LimitedEntropySyntheticTrial will be accessing SyntheticTrialRegistry from within VariationsService. A previous design added VariationsServiceClient::RegisterLimitedEntropySyntheticTrial for this purpose, but this approach will crash the client because of a null g_browser_process (as explained above). For this reason this change also removes VariationsServiceClient::RegisterLimitedEntropySyntheticTrial.



Bug: b/316412206

Change-Id: I1f8cf62d1663f1a033edd192755ccb2a870ac7bf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5242238

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

entry.title: Allow rvalue arrays in as_byte_span, and type-deduce rvalue arrays
entry.content:
Arrays can come in rvalue form as for example `{1, 2, 3}` which

resolves to an `int (&&)[3]` type, and which binds to

`const int (&)[3]` but not `int (&)[3]`.



span thus can be constructed from an rvalue array

but as_byte_span() which returns a span over `const uint8_t` was

expecting a mutable array input, which prevented the use of an

rvalue. Adjust as_byte_span() to match the behaviour of the span()

constructor.



span() also allows type deduction for building a span from an

lvalue array, but it was missed for an rvalue array. Fix this by

allowing `span` to be deduced from a `const T (&)[N]`

type, which then calls the ctor that already exists.



R=tsepez@chromium.org



Bug: 40284755

Change-Id: Ieb69bd9bc525950ed5b2b9ecfa547707ca36fef5

entry.title: Improved page colors calculation on initialization
entry.content:
This CL improves the way page colors is calculated upon initialization.

Previously, PageColors::Init() used PageColors::OnPageColorsChanged(),

which did not ensure that the initial calculation considered the

preferred contrast state. Therefore, this CL replaces

OnPageColorsChanged() with PageColors::OnPreferredContrastChanged(),

which ends up calling OnPageColorsChanged() after accounting for the

user’s contrast preference.



Bug: 40779801

entry.title: Make dir=auto elements without strong characters ltr (rather than inheriting).
entry.content:
This reverts (conditioned on a new DirAutoNoInheritance flag) a previous

change from https://crrev.com/c4557b863d101826932f33757e9398e7fca056c9

and makes it so that dir=auto elements never inherit directionality from

their parent. Instead, when no strong characters are present, they have

LTR directionality, as we did before.



Reverting to our old behavior (and reverting the relevant test to its

old state) seems like the best option given the discussion in

https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/10097 .



Once this ships to stable we can remove the mechanisms used to support

that inheritance.



The changes in html/dom/elements/global-attributes/dir_auto-N-EN.html

and its reference are a direct revert of the prior test change in the CL

above.



The changes in bdi-auto-dir-default.html and

bdi-dir-default-to-auto.html are reverting a newer test change from

https://crrev.com/4278cdb00ac4e727c1123e5eb4aba86509e87c0b .



The new dir-shadow-42 test is a version of dir-shadow-41 with the

directions swapped, to make sure things are tested more thoroughly.



Fixed: 41494751

entry.title: [Office upload] Use SetupOrMoveDialogPage enum to create dialog args
entry.content:
The DialogPage enum was always confusing as it contained pages for the

setup flow and move confirmation, which are handled together, and the

connect to OneDrive page, which is handled completely separately.



Since http://crrev.com/c/4853720 landed, the connect to OneDrive page

enum has become completely unused. It is best to remove it from the

DialogPage enum so it's not confusing when only setup flow and move

confirmation pages are being handled. Rename the DialogPage enum to

SetupOrMoveDialogPage to make to extra clear.

entry.title: SWA: force reinstall on version/locale change
entry.content:
Attempt reinstall on version/locale change, even if icons

were broken in previous session. This allows users to

potentially recover and start installing/launching SWAs again

if the version changes.



Bug: b:323204802

entry.title: v4l2_stateless: Add H265 delegate
entry.content:
The delegate is responsible for filling in all of the data structures

required for the h265 frame to be decoded.



The delegate code was mostly copied exactly from the

|v4l2_video_decoder_delegate_h265.cc| with changes for class naming,

casting, and how the flat stateless submits data to the driver itself.

This is primarily done in the |SubmitFrameMetadata|,

|SubmitSlice|, and |SubmitDecode| functions.



As the current flat stateless is currently not handling protected

playback, the relevant functions/structs have been removed.



Bug: b:325095378

Test: Ran flat stateless on AMP_A_Samsung_7.hevc and

test-25fps.hevc successfully.



Bug: b:325095378

information in it's header file for decoding bitstreams.

entry.title: Sync the limited entropy randomization source between Ash and LaCrOS.
entry.content:
This change follows a similar path to crrev/c/4981747, which syncs the LES values. Note: there is no change to how the LES value is being used currently. The limited entropy randomization source is not yet in use.



According to crrev/c/5152975, the Ash Chrome client and the LaCrOS client will receive the same group assignment for the limited entropy synthetic trial. In case the Ash Chrome client is in the enabled group of the trial, it will sync the limited entropy randomization source to the LaCrOS client, which should also belong to the enabled group. This ensures that the Ash Chrome client and the LaCrOS client receive the same group assignments for studies that are constrained to the layer with LIMITED entropy mode.



Bug: b/315379876

Change-Id: I4b5758a64e17798016ba799eefcb07f48a287676

entry.title: [mahi] content extraction service.
entry.content:
This CL creates the utility process for mahi to extract content from

A11y tree snapshot. As the snapshot can come from any web page, it is

untrustworthy and should be processed in the utility process.



Currently it provides two functions:

1. Returns the content of the snapshot.

2. Returns the content word count of the snapshot.

The content extraction service distills the important content and

returns based on the requirement.



Mahi design doc: http://go/mahi-dd

Content extraction design doc: go/mahi-content-extraction



and will be covered when the other pipe end is implemented. Other files

has been well covered.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TESTS_IN_SEPARATE_CL The service change is trivial

Bug: b/318565573

entry.title: Revert "[UNO] Implement Sign in paused infra"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fdd2b3ac0345a5678270eb686fceeff90b20853a.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5700313371639808



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756034307404520017

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/TurnSyncOnHelperBrowserTestWithParam.PrimaryAccountResetAfterSyncOptInFlowAborted/1](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FTurnSyncOnHelperBrowserTestWithParam.PrimaryAccountResetAfterSyncOptInFlowAborted%2F1?q=VHash%3A6d0a43807ac672d9)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5700313371639808&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5286218&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> [UNO] Implement Sign in paused infra

>

> This CL ensures no crash is introduced in the `TurnSyncOnHelper`. The

> `TurnSyncOnHelper` relied on the `SigninManager` to clear the primary

> account if the account removed on abort is the primary account. This is

> to avoid the account reconcilor crashes. With Uno, the `SigninManager`

> will no longer be created as the primary account should be set/cleared with

> explicit user action in Chrome UIs.

>

> Instead this CL checks if the account being removed is the primary

> account and calls `ClearPrimaryAccount()`. This is CL (1) to support Uno

> sign in paused state.

>

> Bug: b/319402216

> Change-Id: I693214a607975d0209a5b157033314b36ddb7b9d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5286218

> Reviewed-by: David Roger

> Commit-Queue: Monica Basta

> Reviewed-by: Alex Ilin

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260942}

>



Bug: b/319402216

Change-Id: Iacdd747d85b8171e4f29f589c1a97beb90e16459

entry.title: Show preview image while waiting for Picker gif to load.
entry.content:
Loading and decoding gif frames can be slow, so add support for showing

a preview image in PickerGifView while waiting for these frames.



The preview image url will be retrieved from tenor in a similar manner

to the actual gif url. Getting the actual preview image url will be done

in a followup (b:325339604), but for now just add a preview_image_url

attribute to GifData and use a placeholder url.



(Later, we may also consider adding an option to have the gif paused by

default and only fetch frames/animate on hover.)

Original change's description:

> [Mac File Menu] Reland of Display and enable correct Close menu items

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Ensure URL for the same navigation is only added once in the pending allowlist
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/671672, a counter to the pending allowlist was

introduced to fix an issue that the security indicator disappears on

reload. The fix was based on the assumption that DisplayBlockingPage

is only called once for one warning so the URL is only added to the

pending allowlist once.



However, this assumption is no longer valid with async check.

DisplayBlockingPage can be called twice under the following cases:

* When both sync check and async check flag a URL, and they both

complete before WillProcessResponse, they both call

DisplayBlockingPage.

* When async check is completed between WillProcessResponse and

DidFinishNavigation, AsyncCheckTracker calls

DisplayBlockingPage the second time.



This CL ensures that the URL associated with the same navigation id

can only be added to the pending allowlist at most once.



Bug: 40941453

Change-Id: I5b979a48dc70949f72697a872fe02ae9b874d421

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5288943

entry.title: [Tab Groups] Support size one for TabGroupUi
entry.content:
This is part of a series of changes to migrate away from legacy checks

for tab group membership such as `hasOtherRelatedTabs()` and variations

on `getRelatedTabList().size() == 1`. We are migrating to

`isTabInTabGroup` which flag guards a check for whether a tab has a tab

group ID which is the new way of checking if a tab is part of a tab

group and supports tab groups with a single tab. When the flag is off

this falls back to `hasOtherRelatedTabs()`.



This CL migrates the bottom tab strip UI AKA TabGroupUi to use this

new style of check. Since this is the first CL in the migration it

also introduces `isTabInTabGroup` and adds a deprecation announcement

on `hasOtherRelatedTabs`. Internally in TabGroupModelFilter there are

also some minor tweaks to accommodate this.

entry.title: Plumb `kInputTooLong` error from Rust.
entry.content:
Before https://crrev.com/c/5147349 the Chromium API would limit input

sizes *before* calling into Rust. This meant that Rust would never

encounter an input for which a `kInputTooLong` error would need to be

reported.



After https://crrev.com/c/5147349 input-too-long errors were incorrectly

reported by Rust FFI as `kUnknownError`. This CL fixes this. Note that

the impact of this problem was fairly limited because the Rust limits

were much higher than the old limits (old 288 or kMaxInputSize=700 VS

the new 2331 limit for 40-M QR codes).



Bug: 40263739

entry.title: Revert "Enable DPD feature flag on android-arm64-rel"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 152284a9f3e14c2bc36597c18dff82a86d805c7b.



Reason for revert: test crash from android-arm64-rel are mostly caused by the DanglingRawPtrReleased.

Details can be found in https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/325123758#comment3



Original change's description:

> Enable DPD feature flag on android-arm64-rel

>

> The Dangling pointer detector is controlled by a binary flag and a

> runtime flag:

>

> 1. The binary flag enable_dangling_raw_ptr_checks:

> This flag controls the size of PartitionAlloc refcount, it

> increases from 32 bits to 64 bits. It changes the behavior of

> PartitionAlloc when a raw_ptr becomes dangling, calling

> PartitionAlloc’s embedder.

> This flag requires BackupRefPtr and PartitionAlloc to be enabled to

> be effective.

> 2. The runtime flag PartitionAllocDanglingPtr:

> This flag controls the behavior when a dangling pointer is

> detected.

> By default the dangling pointer is ignored.

>

> This CL activates the dangling pointer feature flag on android-arm64-rel

> . This using the binary flag

> "enable_dangling_raw_ptr_feature_flags_for_bots" to change the default.

>

> Additional dangling pointer detection documentation available in:

> https://crsrc.org/c/docs/dangling_ptr.md

>

> CQ activation document:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1j3uw-x9KkdMCdzuWhYr-ryls7-fD3VR3bWwzqeh6NvI/edit?pli=1&resourcekey=0-41nltFNe_IrzbCQ0jEnugA#heading=h.3m3nqcoku183

entry.title: [Event Timing] Expose interactionId to Keypress & keydown/up under composition
entry.content:
This CL changes the logic of generating interaction Id for keyboard

events in performance event timing.



Non-composition:

* Previous behaviour: Interaction id is generated on keyups, and will

match the related keydown backwards.

* New behaviour: Interaction id is now generated on the keydown entry,

and match forward with related keypress and keyup.

Composition(IME, virtual keyboard, etc.):

* Previous behaviour: Interaction id is assigned to each input event

only.

* New behaviour: Interaction id is generated on the first input or

keydown event (whichever comes first) before the compositionupdate,

and any further keydown or input event before the compositionupdate

and any number of keyups after compositionupdate will be matched

with same interaction id.



This may affect the total duration of INP since more events are now

being meatured, eg. keypress.



Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER This CL is also covered by wpt manual test.

Bug: 1456384

Change-Id: Ie736f3f189e9a349badbe03c4a65627ac491eff4

entry.title: Implement local override for Safe Browsing tailored download warnings
entry.content:
This implements a mechanism for registering a local override of the

ClientDownloadResponse::TailoredVerdict proto to be used in place of the

actual server response. This override is registered via the

chrome://safe-browsing WebUI. The goal is to make it easier to locally

reproduce and test the warning UI without making code changes and

compiling Chrome.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/13GR9NIvMP8dIzGvyyjLfUB4RyiGKe323

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Add metrics for WebUI load times.
entry.content:
This is intended to debug the performance issues with the WebUI toolbar.



The hypothesis is that if these metrics are more or less the same both

with and without the toolbar flag, the increase in latency we're

currently seeing stems from showing the side panel UI at a delay

once the content has loaded.



This delay currently only happens for the WebUI toolbar, but it

would be needed for the Views toolbar as well if we weren't

migrating the toolbar to WebUI. We're not setting the Views toolbar

to unavailable before content loads right now, so it shows the UI

before content has loaded, while with the WebUI toolbar, we only

show the toolbar after content has loaded.



Bug: 40275871

Change-Id: I18878ad5ab19a467f75bfbb120fd6dff182865f1

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Try and handle H264Parser::kEOStream case
entry.content:
V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder's H264 parsing code has a provision to return

NOTREACHED() if the parser returns kEOStream [1]. This is a normal

return condition that AdvanceToNextNALU() returns [2] when either it

could not find a NALU in its input buffer or it cannot initialize a

bit reader on it.



My money is that the first one is what is found on the field (see

b/324478176 for the crash link, or go/crash/73f9c0075e3e05ed for an

example) and that it's the first situation (which itself can be due to

[3] either not finding the 0x00 0x00 0x01 start code ([4]) or because

there isn't enough data to fit the start code).



All in all, it seems like this condition describes a strange, maybe

faulty bitstream chunk has been received, so it seems safe to me to

ignore the contents. The action that this CL needs to take is to

assume and signal to upper layers that an H.264 frame boundary has

been found, so whatever is accumulated until then can be reassembled

and sent to the driver.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_stateful_video_decoder.cc;l=1242-1245;drc=d82b9f963354fdc4c8219189b0930b1e9cb5ce2d

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/h264_parser.cc;l=501-521;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa

[3]

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/h264_parser.cc;l=372-392;drc=581b9e8403fdba9f33cc315c56180f841407c86b

[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/h264_parser.cc;l=318;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa



Bug: b:279980150, b:324478176



Change-Id: Iad15c3ccbe351172632f03d110c0684d47aa7c38

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293087

Reviewed-by: Bijan Choobineh‎

Reviewed-by: Justin Green
